item.title: Randall add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description:
"Curious things, habits. People themselves never knew they had them.
[Witness for the Prosecution, also published in The Hound of Death and Other Stories.]" -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Randall add a quote by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "It has long been an axiom of mine that the little things are infinitely the most important." -- Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Randall add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "In a time of deceit telling the truth is a revolutionary act." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "He who controls the past controls the future. He who controls the present controls the past." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Political language is designed to make lies sound truthful and murder respectable, and to give an appearance of solidity to pure wind. " -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The most effective way to destroy people is to deny and obliterate their own understanding of their history." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Perhaps a lunatic was simply a minority of one." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "People sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to do violence on their behalf." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Big Brother is Watching You." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The essence of being human is that one does not seek perfection." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "We shall meet in the place where there is no darkness." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Writing a book is a horrible, exhausting struggle, like a long bout with some painful illness. One would never undertake such a thing if one were not driven on by some demon whom one can neither resist nor understand." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Now I will tell you the answer to my question. It is this. The Party seeks power entirely for its own sake. We are not interested in the good of others; we are interested solely in power, pure power. What pure power means you will understand presently. We are different from the oligarchies of the past in that we know what we are doing. All the others, even those who resembled ourselves, were cowards and hypocrites. The German Nazis and the Russian Communists came very close to us in their methods, but they never had the courage to recognize their own motives. They pretended, perhaps they even believed, that they had seized power unwillingly and for a limited time, and that just around the corner there lay a paradise where human beings would be free and equal. We are not like that. We know what no one ever seizes power with the intention of relinquishing it. Power is not a means; it is an end. One does not establish a dictatorship in order to safeguard a revolution; one makes the revolution in order to establish the dictatorship. The object of persecution is persecution. The object of torture is torture. The object of power is power. Now you begin to understand me." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "To see what is in front of oneâ€™s nose needs a constant struggle." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The greatest enemy of clear language is insincerity." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "In real life it is always the anvil that breaks the hammer..." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Perhaps one did not want to be loved so much as to be understood." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Every generation imagines itself to be more intelligent than the one that went before it, and wiser than the one that comes after it." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "<i>April the 4th, 1984. </i> To the past, or to the future. To an age when thought is free. From the Age of Big Brother, from the Age of the Thought Police, from a dead man - greetings!" -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Sanity is not statistical." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The enemy of the moment always represented absolute evil, and it followed that any past or future agreement with him was impossible." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "You asked me once,' said O'Brien, 'what was in Room 101. I told you that you knew the answer already. Everyone knows it. The thing that is in Room 101 is the worst thing in the world." -- George Orwell

item.title: Randall add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Randall add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Randall add a quote by Trenton Lee Stewart
item.description: "Rules and school are tools for fools! I don't give two mules for rules." -- Trenton Lee Stewart

item.title: Randall add a quote by Trenton Lee Stewart
item.description: "You must remember, family is often born of blood, but it doesn't depend on blood. Nor is it exclusive of friendship. Family members can be your best friends, you know. And best friends, whether or not they are related to you, can be your family." -- Trenton Lee Stewart
